reviews.sentence: Returned again to la jola. I pretty much always stay at the travelodge in la jola. The prices are reasonable the rooms clean and big enough and you can walk to wind and sea just a block away. desk people are always willing to help and cleaning crews are on top of things.

Awesome Place to Stay. We stayed on a Sunday to Wednesday in January and loved being at the La Jola Travelodge. We stayed in the penthouse which is pretty unique for any motel hotel in that it has no shared walls so lots of windows and is surrounded by an expansive lanai. The room and especially the lanai have a distant ocean view that pictures just do not do justice since in a picture your eye is drawn to the clutter of roof tops but when you are actually there they just do not detract much from the enjoyment of the sun shining on the water. And in the other directions you look out over the town to a distant mesa green for us in January. so really you get 270 degrees of nice to really nice view. The back part behind the room has a snarled mess of power lines but it is not the direction you are ever looking in. I can not really believe a previous grumpy. reviewer chose to post a picture of that as representative. it is not. Pros. Clean and neat as a pin Super nice staff especially Dany and Lupita. very welcoming and helpful Convenient location with Bird Rock and Pacific Beach what a crazy youthful scene THAT place is would be great for families with teens. in one direction and La Jola proper in the other direction. Note that the Travelodge is technically in La Jola but not in the main Cove and Shores areas which personally we preferred being away from downtown. It seemed a bit hectic down in those main areas. Quiet ish. you are next to La Jola Blvd which has a fair amount of mellow but steady traffic during the day but the traffic dies back to nothing at night. We were never bothered by the traffic and we live in a very rural quiet area so would have noticed if it were obnoxious. Cool beach and bluffs one short block away. The first night we walked to the beach and along the beach and bluffs all the way to downtown. It was a very nice very beautiful walk with all kind of intriguing rock formations that were sculpted by the ocean. It was low tide would be challenging to do during high tide. Cons The only thing to keep in mind perhaps is that this is not a fancy spa hotel. If you are looking for granite and tile turned down sheets with chocolates on the pillows then keep looking. It is not the place I had want to spent an anniversary or honeymoon or whatnot. But as a home base from which you go exploring and have a really nice place to go back to it is perfect. Neutral. The parking is tight but it worked even for our biggish truck.

super. The hotel is clean people are very friendly. The front desk is ready to help with anything you need. The breakfast is fresh. The house keeping is amazing. The best hotel I ever stayed. Will recommend everyone. Olga Dany and all staff work as a team to make sure you are comfortable. No matter what you need it is already there for you right away. Thank you.

VERY PLEASED. We had five days at this very pleasant abode. First of all we loved Tricia who greeted us warmly at the reception desk and was always helpful warm profession and fun. A bonus is that she is German. That has to be great for the German guests. The room was comfortable and clean clean clean. Not a fancy room but very adequate with a wonderful bed. Our room number 215 looked out on some palm trees which helped set the mood for our visit. The location was exceptional being so close to a beautiful beach with surfers joggers dog walkers etc. We went down each morning and walked and sat on the benches and read. So many colorful happenings. We loved it. The morning breakfast was better than most because the pastries were exceptional. This was a beautiful find at a very reasonable price. You will be pleased as we were. If we come back to Lajola we will certainly stay here again.

Amazing Spot in La Jola. La Jola Beach Travelodge blew away any expectations we had of it last weekend. Being a budget hotel we did not expect much but we received a ton of value for our money. First off the location is perfect. Only a short 5 minute walk or so to the beach restaurants shopping and anything else you could want. Secondly their customer service is second to none. The front desk attendants were GREAT. Very helpful going out of their way for your every need. The room itself was just ok but very clean and certainly everything you need for a stay where you are not going to be in it a whole lot. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Very courteous and kind staff. Clean rooms with flexible housekeeping hours. Barely a block walk to ocean view. Good parking on both street and parking lot.

Great family fun. The hotel staff were fantastic. They are kind happy and certainly kid friendly. Check in and out was simple. The location was close to the beach. We watched the surfers and the waves at the beach down the street. It is a short drive to Mission beach and Sea World. The hotel is also close to the Childrens pool area where the seals and pups are. The continental breakfast was great. Coffee was great. The room was a nice size with a refrigerator microwave and toaster. The only thing I do not recommend is walking around the neighborhood to the La Jola Cove. it is farther than you think and I got the impression that the locals really do not like strangers walking through their neighborhoods. Other than that I would recommend the hotel and will stay here again. There is a washer and dryer located at the pool. Pool and Jacuzi were fun for kids and I.
Great Location. Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean but small.
Great purchase for the price. Good price for the area clean nice little pool. Heater was a little loud but overall a great purchase for the price. Really close to a beautiful beach good area.

LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. I am gon na start with the best part. The location is great the beach is right there and parking is free. Will was very cool and helpful. I was able to check in quite early and that was very appreciated even if it not the norm. Okay so now for the bad. It needs a facelift but I am okay with it as is because a facelift would also raise rates. Also it can be a bit lid if you like to sleep in a it because housekeeper can be heard doors down from your own. Bottom line is the place is older but staff was great and I loved how close it was to the beach without actually being there and close to main attractions without the crowds.

Old tiny and construction problems. We stayed for one night. Chose this place for its location. So glad I was not there longer. The Bad. Half of the hotel was under construction that involved asbestos removal. We were not offered a discount or anything for this major inconvenience. Construction trucks took up most of the tiny parking lot. Lots of yelling among the workers. Debris everywhere. If I had not arrived so late I would not have asked for a refund. Also the bathroom was so tiny. Washcloths very old thin. The AYKM. Found an old pair of socks on the floor in the closet. The good. We enjoyed talking to the front desk staff. She was really sweet. The front desk staff Su Casa restaurant across the street is good. We took a Lyft into the Cove area for art galleries and dinner. Would have been nice to receive a warning about the construction so I could have made other arrangements. Expedia had a no refund on this room.
Good sized room. there is a seperate bedroom aside from the two beds in the living area. Really good spot if you love the beach because its really close.

pleasant. Location to the beach and easy to walk to restaurants. The property is beautiful in the renovated rooms but the construction is still going on and it was very noisy early in the morning with tools construction etc. The staff are all exceptional. Erica gave such great suggestions for restaurants in the area.

Pleasant. New clean room great location. Construction. It is absolutely impossible to enjoy your peace when there ’s loud banging and drilling going on for hours. We got a double rate since it was New Years Eve drove from far got no rest at all. You ca n’t even stay in your nice room noice is extremely loud walls are shaking you just want to get out of there. Got a small discount and a frugal comment from the management ‘ it is perfectly legal to do construction at 8 AM ’. Shame. Left with devastation of being ripped off. Place looks poor from outside. Clearly this hotel is not ready to accommodate guests.
Exceptional. Very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good but sometime not a lot of choice. Location is excellent. Very close to the beach. Nothing.

We loved the caring service we received at The Shoal. The free parking was excellent. Great room at great value. While the hotels rooms were not as soundproof my wife could here me in the shower from outside the door I understand this is more of an issue of the structure of the hotel. While some one could see a lot of construction around one could see this was to improve the rooms so that is a good thing for the future.
Too expensive for what you get Location. Floor of time shower slippery. Room not ready when promised. Not enough clean towels washcloths. Breakfast had rotten oranges and only carb foods.
The small feel of the motel gives it an intimate feel. The staff is so accommodating kind and helpful. The rooms are spacious and also cozy. Easy 5 minute walk to the beach.

One star is for the hotel staff in the front office. They are sweet girls. The other star is for location as you can walk to the beach. Lack of stars for the following. First night our good old neighbors were blasting their tv so loud our room was shaking there was constant fighting which I do n’t know if it was due to the people or the movie. Went to front desk to ask if we could switch rooms and they said the people were checking out that day. Okay fine. Then called to say they asked them to check out early due to the inconvenience. They only had an hour left before they had to check out but I appreciated the gesture. Second and third mornings I discovered room 21 is right next to the cleaning ladies who scream their good morning conversations to each other right in front of our room waking us up in kind of an annoying manner with more screaming and yelling every morning. Cute place but thankfully it ’s our last night. If room 21 is offered do n’t take the cleaning staff is in their defense and just doing their job. But try to have some respect for ur guests who are tired after long days of sight seeing and surfing. All in all not worth the 159 charged us per night. Spa is yellow as well and does n’t seem very clean. Again cute place but not worth the issues.

It was great Totally remodeled since it was a Travelodge. Short walk to the beach with bench. They totally remodeled since it was a Travelodge. Love the fact that it was a very short distance from the ocean and there are benches right there on the beach. Rocky and a little beach. Short on parking.
